Legal_Issue: Whether plaintiffs can obtain an interlocutory injunction to prevent infringement
Governing_Law: Principles governing interlocutory injunctions in intellectual property cases
Evidence_Assessment: Functional differences in designs noted; difficulty in quantifying harm
Burden_of_Proof: On plaintiffs to demonstrate serious question to be tried, irreparable harm, and balance of convenience
Credibility_Factor: Doubts exist about the strength of plaintiffs' case
Legal_Rule: Interlocutory injunctions require: (1) serious question to be tried, (2) irreparable harm if not granted, and (3) balance of convenience favoring applicant
Standard_of_Review: Equitable discretion based on tripartite test for interlocutory injunctions
Procedural_Issue: Application for interim relief during litigation
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged infringement of garment bag patent and locking trolley design
Review_Standard: Balance of convenience, adequacy of damages as remedy
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Court analyzed patent validity, likelihood of infringement, and equitable considerations
Key_Evidence_Considered: Design functionality, potential market competition, adequacy of monetary compensation
Legal_Framework: Patent law and industrial design rights protection
Applicant_Challenge: Failure to establish irreparable harm and strong prima facie case
Court_Result: No temporary halt on defendant's product sales
Legal_Rule_Source: Common law principles on interlocutory injunctions
Standard_of_Proof: Prima facie case with serious question to be tried
Defendant_Response: Denial of infringement; assertion that damages are an adequate remedy
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence on design patents, comparative product analysis
Remedy_Sought: Temporary restraining order against product sale
Legal_Provision: Patent Act provisions implied; equitable jurisdiction for injunctions
Authority: National court with jurisdiction over IP disputes
Legal_Provision_Cited: Implied reference to patent enforcement and injunction provisions
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Non-infringement and availability of damages as remedy
Jurisdiction: National jurisdiction over intellectual property matters
Governing_Rule: Tripartite test for interlocutory injunctions in IP cases
